intro: Dialium anomalum, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical tree native to Africa and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, with a sweet, juicy pulp. Its bark and leaves are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or swampy areas.
